result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth T Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, plus costs and disbursements.  To be paid from monies to be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
No contact with any gangs or be involved in gang activity.  No contact with Marquis L., Takeyra J. or Tiora W. either directly or by third parties.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED.  Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.
Undergo a mental health evaluation. Follow any treatment recommended.

Continued no contact with Marquis L., Takeyra J. or Tiora W. personally or by third party contact.
No gang involvement or activity.
No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensd physician.  
No alcohol.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed. Urine screens to ensure compliance.

supervisions.notes:
DNA sample ordered in 15CF395.
The Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess firearms and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Per order dated October 14, 2021, Appeal No. 2015XX1459-CR (2015CF395, 2015CF400 and 2015CF2411), IT IS ORDERED that the motions filed by Attorney Tempska to reinstate and extend Lewis's appellate deadlines are denied.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the motion filed by Attorney Muller to extend Lewis's appellate deadlines is denied.

State Public Defender Report
Motion to Withdraw as Appointed Postconviction Counsel
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, calendar successor, for review. mag

Per order dated October 1, 2021, Appeal No. 2015XX1459-CR (2015CF395, 2015CF400, 2015CF2411), IT IS ORDERED that the motion to withdraw filed by Attorney Tempska is denied without prejudice.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, within fifteen days after the date of this order, the State shall file a response to the motion to reinstate and extend appellate deadlines filed by Attorney Tempska on September 24, 2021.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the motion filed by Attorney Muller is held in abeyance pending further order of this court.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Kenneth T Lewis not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel waived his client's appearance. Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Guilty verdict received and filed.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deliberations continue.    At the hour of 10:48 am the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of Guilty, which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Right to Testify filed.
filed.
Stipulation and Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits filed.

Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case recalled for afternoon reporter.
Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.   Jury in the box at 2:01 pm.   State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.   Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate jurors selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:40 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies JoAnn Karczewski, Robert Pekar and Daniel Klatkiewicz who were duly sworn for that purpose.   Court recessed for the day.

Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Detective Mitchell Ward, Milwaukee Police Detective Chad Vartanian, Intelligence Analyst Nicole Smith,  Exhibits  16, 17, 18-24, 25, 26, 28, 29, 30, 31, 27, 32, 33, 34,  offered and received.  Exhibits  17, 18-24, 4, 28, 29, 30, 31, 27, 33,  Published to the jury. Jury out of box at 10:35 am.  Jury in box at 10:55 am.  Sworn for the State:  Milwaukee Police Officer Daniel Keller, Exhibits 35, 37, 36, 3, 38, 39, 40, 42, 41, 43, 44,  Exhibits 36, 37, Published to the Jury.  Jury out of the box at 12:16 pm.  Court recessed for lunch.

Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.
Trial continued.  Jury in box at 1:59 pm.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Jeffrey Krueger, Milwaukee Police Detective Steven Johnson, . Exhibits 10, 11, 12 offered and received.  Jury out of box at 3:15 pm.  Jury in box at 3:41 pm.  Sworn for the state:  Patrick K., Exhibits 13, 14, 15 offered and received.  Sworn for the state:  Tiora W.,  Jury out of box at 4:50 pm.  Court recessed for the day.
Order to Rescind Defendant's Telephone/Mail/Visitation Privileges, signed by the Court.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties stipulate to two prior convictions of State's upcoming witness.  Record made by defense counsel as to his office's representation of testifying witness on a now-closed case.  Trial resumes.  Jury back in box.  Sworn for the State:  Marquis L.  Exhibits #6 - #9 offered and received.   At the hour of 11:55 a.m., the Court excused the jurors for the evening with instructions to return by 1:30 p.m.  Jury out of box.  Court in recess.
/to Cancel Warrant, signed and filed.

Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State's in-court officer:  Detective Chad Vartanian.  Case recalled for the afternoon reporter.  Jury panel back in box.  Voir dire resumes.   Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, Wisconsin qualified to serve as jurors in the above-entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by State and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Ms. Takeyra J.  Exhibits #1, #2, #4 offered, received and published to the jury.  At the close of the business day, the Court released the jurors for the evening with instructions to return by 10:30 a.m. on 5/12/15.  Jury out of box.  

The State's police officers produced the State's defaulting witness.  Court ordered defendant to appear in court tomorrow morning, as ordered by this court.  If she agreed to do same, the Court would vacate the bench warrant.  She stated on the record that she would.  Court ordered bench warrant WITHDRAWN.

Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Kenneth T Lewis in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court grants State's motion for sequestration of  witnesses.  State's in-court officer:  Detective Chad Vartanian.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 10:45 a.m.  At the hour of 11:55 a.m., the Court excused the jury panel for the noon hour with instructions to return to the jury room in Room 113.  Jury panel out of box.  Administrative strikes addressed on the record.  Court to carry 14 jurors - two alternates.  Court in recess for the noon hour.
Defaulting witness, Tiora W., failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFAULTING WITNESS REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Arrest Warrant issued in error.
Defaulting witness, Tiora W., failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Kenneth T Lewis not in court, in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waives his client's appearance.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Court set the following filing schedule: movant to file any motions by 3/16/15; response due by 3/26/15; reply due by 3/31/15.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists are due within one (1) week of the final pretrial date; any alibi notices must be filed per statute.  State to turn over additional discovery requested by defense counsel.  Court ordered case also set for status to ensure all discovery was received.  Status conference scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
